Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: Eager to mend its tarnished image, Los Angeles has really put out the welcome mat for tomorrow's summit. The city promises quite a party as leaders from Japan, China, South Korea, Australia, the U.S. and others begin talks for the largest free-trade treaty in history.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I can't stand it -- half an hour to get to the stupid school every morning... with no music...  [Just our damn Nanny...]

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: [Stay in the car.]

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Son of a bitch!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Pete... please... we have to be up early tomorrow. Call the police.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Yeah, right.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Shit!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Not again...

Speaker: westec guard
Dialogue: Everybody... chill! Bikini boy! On the ground!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Asshole was trying to boost my car!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Mike -- call 911!

Speaker: neighbor
Dialogue: Been trying...  He's the good guy, you schumcks.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I hate this fuckin' town.

Speaker: joy
Dialogue: There are six bathrooms in this house, Sam.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: But only one with a smoking section.

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: [Go change.]

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: [You smell like a fireplace.]

Speaker: governess
Dialogue: Mrs. Han... I am very sick today...

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: Very good. You may go now...

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: ...Good morning, Summit Day! It's gonna be the Super Bowl, the 4th of July, the Olympics and Woodstock all rolled into one! All over town there'll be parades, concerts, rallies, festivals... So get out there everyone, but plan your drive- time accordingly! This is Bobbi Marchfelder, your Eye in the Sky...

Speaker: president
Dialogue: ...It's an honor hosting my fellow leaders in Los Angeles, the capitol city of the Pacific Rim...

Speaker: morning anchor
Dialogue: We'll see the menu for Mayor Simpson's Brentwood barbecue, right after this...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I was watching that.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: If I hear one more Beach Boys song, I'll shoot myself.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I said, if we were having sex once in a while, you wouldn't need to ride that fucking bike every morning.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Be right with you...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Have you gotten any sleep lately?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Shop's gonna tow the car in -- goddamn ignition's trashed.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Take mine. I'll ride in with Diane.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: You ask me, those suckers are a lost cause.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: It's not for you.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: You mean it's not for you.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I don't chase car thieves in my underwear. C'mon, you'd die of boredom if we ever sold this house and moved.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I'd die of shock, from finding anyone dumb enough to buy the place. Even for what it's worth now.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Lots of people bought at the top of the market...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: That sure cheers me right up.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I don't know why we even talk about it. The city's not the problem. So we move. It wouldn't matter. What's that saying: "Wherever you go, there you are."

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I hope you're current on your tetanus booster. Was it worth it?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: One cut... two assholes in the hospital... Yep.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Well, another day of baby-sitting my favorite bunch of people...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Ask for a transfer.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: They're not gonna transfer me. You know damn well why I was bumped down to guard duty...  My outstanding people skills.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I hate this fuckin' town.

Speaker: joy
Dialogue: Can we give Lisa a ride?

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Hey, Joy... Sam...

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Excellent -- I can't hear him!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Armor-plated. Bulletproof. Bomb- proof.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Perfect car for L.A.  Starts, too.

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: Yo, Dave the Computer Man! Actually escaped the office!

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: I'm doin' field upgrades. Gives 'em a chance to hose out my cage.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Who's the fuckin' gargoyle?

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: Their Chief of Security, Colonel Lee.

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: "Chuckles," as we're inclined to call him.  Friggin' graveyard shift...

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: Love to know what dope made it the Bureau's job to give full-time protection to foreign consulates.  Cup a mud?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Not if you made it. Why don't you get Sabatini to brew the java? She's the alleged chick.

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: Blow me.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Where's Carson?

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: On his way. Some creeps tried to rip off his Mustang last night.  They cut the ragtop.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Motherfuckers...

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Latest and greatest. Wireless network link-ups.

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: Whoa, slow down, I'm gonna pee.

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: Me, too.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Ingrates.

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: You see that I'm serious in my intention, yes?  If you cooperate, you and your children will be home for dinner tonight.

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: [You must stay here.]

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: Someone took my family!

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: You got no jurisdiction outside this property!

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: Yank his fuckin' leash!

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: My men are going!

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: It's a white telephone van, driving west on Washington Boulevard.

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: Keys!

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: You're ridin' shotgun.

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: Cherry?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Under the seat.

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: Siren?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: I don't know! I'm never in a fuckin' hurry..!

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: Someone snatched Han's family! White phone van, westbound on Washington!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Give me a secure radio!

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Clothes make the man.

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: The man makes payments on his Visa.

Speaker: secretary
Dialogue: Mr. Walther... priority line!

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: I'll inform channels and get a copter in the air. For God's sake, keep it quiet. Do what you can, but don't endanger civilians or the family!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: You bet -- nice and easy.

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: I know he left already. I'm familiar with the concept of time zones. Find his ass.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Robbins, Sabatini... Chopper's on its way.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Check it out! Ahead, on the right!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Yeah... but it seems too easy... I'll move up; he won't suspect a civilian car. Stay back, then get on his ass when I signal. We'll box him in.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: If the Mod Squad gets in your way, don't be shy about getting 'em out.

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: Don't puke... I hate when guys puke!

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: I need to concentrate!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: He's gonna wrap it around something!

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: You should not have interfered!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I'm in no mood...

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: Forget about him!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Let's get back to the Consulate.

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: Does anyone need to use the rest room? This will be your last opportunity for a few hours.  And you... what is your name?

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Lisa...

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: No, Mrs. Han, this one. Thank you.

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: You afford me some additional bargaining power. But not much.

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: The right meters indicate motion. There are pressure sensors inside the armrests and seats. The sensors don't like to get wet, so I hope you were honest about not needing to use the loo. If you make any excess movements, or try to leave your chair, the circuit will be closed.

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: Kaboom...

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: Do each of you understand?

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: Keep your wits, and all will be fine.

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Carson?  Walther. Who told the Ambassador?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: His Security Chief.  There was a civilian with them -- fifteen-year-old girl from across the street. We're trying to reach the parents.

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Goddamn it...  Look, Mrs. Han was the North Korean Premier's niece! We're hearing rumors they're gonna make a major issue out of what happened here...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I'm not so sure what happened here. Something smells. Asshole was acting like he wanted us to spot him...

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: What the hell are you talking about?

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Ambassador Han... my deepest --

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: -- I have no wish for condolences. Just answers.

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: As soon as we have any to give...

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: Yoon..?!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Start a trace!

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Mr. Secretary... they're alive!

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: You are tapping our phones?!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Yeah, you didn't know. And I'm Meryl Streep.

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: I want you to remember the feeling you had when you thought your family was dead, and use it to inform the choices you're about to make.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Say you want to talk to the kids...

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: I need to know my children are all right.

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: There is a television in my office.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Play the tape back. I might be able to pull the electronic serial number out of the subcarrier.

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: Hey, great idea...

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: P'yngyang must approve the ransom...

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Of course. The FBI's top Hostage Negotiator is on the way --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: -- Goddamn Negotiator's the last thing we need! This asshole sound like he was interested in bargaining?

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: We have people who are experts in these situations. We really feel it would be best if you let them coordinate everything...

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Let's get on it...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: ...You're gonna just pay up, count on his good nature to return the family?!

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: It's the President's intention to keep this quiet, move forward with the Summit, and work with the North Koreans. Jesus, you've already embarrassed the shit out of us over the phone surveillance --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: -- They know their phones are tapped! They tap our fucking phones!

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: That's not the point! The point is not acknowledging it!  We got an international incident brewing, with a country we were practically at war with last year! Our best Negotiator is gonna run point. If you got a problem, you can take the goddamn rest of the day off.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: This Consulate is my responsibility.

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Not any more.

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: That's the Negotiator. You do the briefing.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: ...Our worst enemy'll be the city. There are events gearing up all around town, and a dozen world leaders arriving. Add the Friday rush hour and usual L.A. bad behavior and it'll be a nightmare out there by 3 PM. It all works to the advantage of the kidnapper, hinders our pursuit efforts...  You don't agree?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I'm wondering whether to believe him when he says he's strictly motivated by money.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: You see one word of Peoples'- Liberation, Holy-Jihad, Revolutionary whatever-it-is-we're-pissed-off-about- this-week bullshit in this entire letter?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I still want to check the MO against known politicals, terrorists --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: -- Already doing it. We're coordinating with the Secret Service, the NSA and the CIA.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Have someone talk to the LAPD, give them a cover story for the media about the crash on La Cienega.

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me Doctor Knoll is your wife?!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: If she'd changed her name when we got married, I wouldn't have to.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I'm so enjoying this opportunity to finally work together...

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Jesus, forget I asked.  Any thoughts on the kidnapper's thoughts?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Everything indicates he's working alone. And his concerns do seem to be solely about the money... so I agree that he's only using the Summit and the tension with North Korea to create extreme motivation to pay the ransom.

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: I will bring the money to him.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: My ass.

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: The hostages are citizens of the People's Republic of Korea --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: -- Hey, do I go to the torture chambers in your prisons, tell you how to do your job?

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: All right, you're outta here! Is this the same insubordinate crap you pulled at Beverly Thrift?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I'll coordinate the drop.

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: Perhaps that is better. Inspector Carson knows the terrain --

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: -- Then he can come with me.

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: It's settled.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: It sucks.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: But it means we can get on with it.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Get one thing straight, Mr. Walther. If the Bureau had listened to Pete, Beverly Thrift never would've happened.

Speaker: javal
Dialogue: That's more like it...

Speaker: operative
Dialogue: ...They've got the Premier agreeing to the hard-line position --

Speaker: operative
Dialogue: More to follow...

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: I wanted to be home by now, take the kids to the rally in Boyle Heights.

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: We got a cabin in Big Bear. By now, L.A. was supposed to be a brown blotch in the rear-view mirror.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: He'll expect a homing device --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: -- I expect him to expect it. He'll check the cash with an RF detector...  And I doubt the asshole will have an X-ray machine or a metal detector.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Why must you always refer generically to criminals as "assholes?"

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Gosh, you're right. It could undermine their self-esteem and spoil their chances for rehabilitation.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: You been reading my magazines in the bathroom again?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: He's really exhibiting pressured speech... big effort here to sound calm. Same with his vocabulary... if he were in control, he wouldn't feel such a need to sound that way.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Just tell me if we can use it.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: If we needle him he could get sloppy and give us an opening, but I'm not going to risk it. This is the worst kind of perpetrator: anything makes him deviate from his carefully- scripted plan, he could become extremely volatile.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: It's real important we don't lose him. He didn't go through all the trouble of designing that bomb not to use it.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Well, it ain't gonna happen.  Not again...

Speaker: president
Dialogue: What the hell is the big crisis?

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Bullshit. They're just ticked because we don't want the Chinese dragging their asses into the treaty talks.

Speaker: intelligence officer
Dialogue: We have a covert operative in place. He reports the hard-liners and moderates in the High Command are arguing about how to respond, should the Premier's niece and her children should be killed.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Respond?! Christ. What about the damn Premier?

Speaker: cia chief
Dialogue: Which is a real possibility. Most of those old-fart Generals don't want to -more-

Speaker: president
Dialogue: I don't want to deal with this right now! Get our diplomats on it. Tell the North we'll pay the ransom for 'em... Placate 'em! And make damn sure we get that family back in one piece. Who's in charge in L.A.?

Speaker: fbi chief
Dialogue: The Bureau, Sir. We have a crack team in place.

Speaker: cia chief
Dialogue: Carson? He was demoted from the FBI Hostage Program, couple years back. And this did happen on his watch...

Speaker: fbi chief
Dialogue: There's no way he could've prevented this abduction! Besides, I've got one of my top Negotiators in charge --

Speaker: president
Dialogue: -- Whatever. I want a total news blackout and I want this over with, quickly! Without giving those Commie little bastards any excuse to shit all over my Summit!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Yes, please go ahead...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: -- I'm only here to see that everyone gets what they want --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Shit... no way we can set up a stake- out in... -more-

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Must've bought a house same time we did.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: There's about a hundred ways he can scurry off like a cockroach from here... So spread out.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Our boy's in a fuckin' ice cream truck!

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Son of a bitch!  He found the bleepers -- both of them!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Fuck! Okay, stay back. It's not like he'll be hard to see in that truck. Which way's he heading?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: All right... Carefully...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Watch it! We need him alive!

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: Turn around!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: FBI. Call our office, they'll take care of you.

Speaker: biker
Dialogue: I'm a taxpayer! I'm a goddamn dentist!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Just don't kill yourself, you piece of shit...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Helicopter or two would be nice!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Love to be in the loop on this...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Not just now, dear...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I coulda had a ranch... maybe some horses... but no, we moved to L.A.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: He's on foot, at the base of the elevator tower!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Goddammit! He's in a blue Geo!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Fingerprint it.  He's not gonna tell us where to find the hostages... -more-

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Figure it out?! With what?!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Get back to his van. There were no plates, but check the VIN, look it over, then meet us at the Consulate.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: ...Scrounge us some bodies: National Guard, State Troopers, CHPs, local PD's, meter maids --

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: -- They're gonna search the whole city in a goddamn hour..?!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Look, I don't need you to tell me how fucked we are!

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Fuck you!! Every time you're on a case something explodes!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Stop! The clock's running! Arguing is a luxury we can't afford! -more-

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: I need some fuckin' ink!!

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: This is impossible! How can you even begin to find them?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Well, the normal procedure is to negotiate with the perpetrator...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Let's take stock. We've got a picture of where he hid the family, and recordings of his calls --

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: -- That's right! We can send them to our experts for analysis...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Same with his fingerprints. But that means we need high-quality image and data transmission. We can piss away ten minutes coptering this shit to our offices in Westwood, or we can use your surveillance equipment.

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: There is no surveillance equipment. This is a diplomatic facility --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: -- You want to play games, fine.

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: Take them upstairs.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: South Korean Consulate's just down the street -- want to take a listen?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Shitcan that thing, will you?!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Got a digital scanner?

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: Analog.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Dave -- get in here. Bring your computer, a city map, and the tapes of the ransom calls.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Colonel, you saw the perp. Describe him to the Ambassador, see if it's anyone he knows.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: This is Carson in L.A. There's a set of prints coming over. Narrow the search criteria: Male, thirties, Caucasian... French, Belgian, Swiss, maybe Canadian. Try kidnappers and bombers first. We need an answer in fifteen minutes.

Speaker: fingerprint tech
Dialogue: That yellow air out there finally rot your brain?! It's impossible!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Newman in Audio Analysis...

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: He quit, couple weeks ago. Opened a bed and breakfast in Wyoming.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Damn... they get HBO? I'd sure like to see the fight tonight.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Get those tapes transferred to a sound guy. We need ambient and background analysis, the whole enchilada.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Enchilada -- you saying that because I'm Mexican?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: No... 'cause you're fat.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Photo enhancement... Isn't there some amazing tech with the LAPD --

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: -- Bronsky. Transferred to Seattle PD a month ago.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Jesus H. Christ...

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: I'd send it to Langley. Let the CIA earn their keep.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Do it.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Given his behavior, this orange residue... I'd say Desoxyn, 25 mg. Amphetamines.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Any significance?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: It's consistent with the lone wolf scenario: A handful of these is pure bravery-in-a-bottle, 'til the psychosis and paranoia kick in.  We could check pharmacy records, on the remote chance he got them legally... if we had a couple of weeks, that is.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Get the Bureau on it.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Forget it. It's a waste of manpower.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Look, goddammit, you start skipping no-chance-in-hell leads, we can all quit and go to the beach right now.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: He grabbed the family at 8:30. The last certain visual we had was just before his van went into the alley on La Cienega at 8:42. He called the

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: That gives him about fifty minutes to get to his location, move and secure the hostages, and activate his time bomb.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: He probably waited a while to pad the time -- he wanted us know the family was still alive...  ...So these crazy bastards wouldn't throw a premature shit hemorrhage, but he didn't want to call too soon, either. I say they're within 15 to 20 minutes, via surface streets, of where we last saw them.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: The most densely-populated part of the L.A. basin. This narrows it down to about 200,000 dwellings.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: He was traveling west --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: -- Bet he doubled back.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: C'mon, that's total conjecture --

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: -- I'd trust his instincts when dealing with maniacs. He is deeply disturbed.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: You're telling me?

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Meaning?

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Are they out of their fuckin' minds?! What kind of retaliation?

Speaker: cia chief
Dialogue: They're threatening to pull a Saddam Hussein: remember the Scuds he lobbed at Jerusalem during Desert Storm?  They're talking about firing a missile into Los Angeles --

Speaker: president
Dialogue: -- A goddamn WHAT??

Speaker: intelligence officer
Dialogue: Best guess is an AS-15, medium-range cruise -- their version of our Tomahawk, launched from offshore.

Speaker: vice president
Dialogue: Still, for their purposes it's perfect: Hit somewhere in L.A., take out a city block or two...

Speaker: president
Dialogue: So if we know it's coming, we can knock it out of the fuckin' sky!

Speaker: president
Dialogue: -- You're saying we got all this lousy hardware and can't stop one goddamn missile??

Speaker: president
Dialogue: I want an immediate search for all ships within range.

Speaker: fbi chief
Dialogue: We better inform the other leaders, stall on the Summit --

Speaker: president
Dialogue: There's no reason to panic yet -- they can't launch until after the family's confirmed dead!

Speaker: cia chief
Dialogue: Afraid that's not the case...

Speaker: intelligence officer
Dialogue: The North Korean Premier holds what we call a "Brinksman Switch." He's able to destroy a missile in flight, right up to the moment before it achieves its target.

Speaker: cia chief
Dialogue: Our Op says they've timed their

Speaker: fbi chief
Dialogue: And if the family turns up okay, they'll just make it self-destruct.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Shit! I really don't need this today!

Speaker: vice president
Dialogue: We're forgetting one thing here: the family. Intelligence is sure the North will abort their attack if Mrs. Han and her kids are safely returned?

Speaker: cia chief
Dialogue: Absolutely. Their whole game depends on claiming a legitimate provocation.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: I'd like to turn 'em into a radioactive parking lot.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Believe me, the North drops one in my fuckin' city, I'm dropping ten in theirs. Get some bombers in the air. And don't tell me any more bad news!

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: ...Phone company decal's a fake. DMV says the van was purchased a week ago from a private party in Santa Monica. I called 'em; they said the guy paid cash, and he fits our boy's description. Signed the name "Douglas McArthur" to the Transfer of Title.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: He signed the name of the Allied Commander during the Korean War. Maybe he was a political.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: No. The phony ice cream truck, the booby-trapped chairs... he could've -more-

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Who's got those kinds of skills: Electronics, vehicle customizing, computers, explosives?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Military. Cop, maybe. Shit, your average high-school student if they're so inclined. My guess is our perp used off-the-shelf equipment for everything except the C-4, and that's only slightly harder to get than crack or heroin, if you know who to ask.

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: This is Bobbi Marchfelder, your Eye in the Sky... back to you, Brent...

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: Keep... the sun... to my left!!

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: What's new on the kidnapping rumor?

Speaker: cameraman
Dialogue: Nada. Total news blackout.

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: Go back over the hill.

Speaker: news pilot
Dialogue: We got the valley traffic report in fifteen --

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: -- "Stalled vehicle! One lane closed! Sig alert..!" I'll improvise!

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: What are you lookin' at? I was the morning anchor in Houston! And I'm one break away from getting out of this stupid fuckin' whirlybird!

Speaker: joy
Dialogue: Why us?

Speaker: joy
Dialogue: What if something goes wrong?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I'm going to the kidnapping site.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I want to talk to the witnesses.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Great, we'll hire a bus.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Cellular company says he was using a phone with a cloned number.

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: Big surprise. Have 'em send a list of the numbers called on the account.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: That's what I'm trying to get. They're saying I need a subpoena.  I'm listening to Michael fuckin' Bolton!

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: Walther! Get on the horn to Justice and deal with this!

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: A lot of the components are made by the same manufacturer -- a car security company.

Speaker: young cop
Dialogue: Inspector! Look at this...  "Dragon's Breath..?"

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Twelve-gauge shell filled with magnesium and ignition powder. Shit's worse than napalm -- Geneva Convention outlawed it for warfare.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Then how did he get it?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Easy -- you can buy 'em mail order.  Where's the Consulate's car?

Speaker: young cop
Dialogue: Uh... apparently it was stolen...

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: Stolen!? What is it with you people --

Speaker: young cop
Dialogue: -- What's this "you people" shit?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Shut up!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: He means all of us "you people."

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Find it! How many bulletproof Mercedes could be cruising around Crenshaw?

Speaker: young cop
Dialogue: You'd be surprised...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I hate this fuckin' town.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Wasted trip: Witnesses say he was working alone, and he was a vicious son of a bitch. Old news.

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: And our car was stolen.

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: I felt safer when I was the Ambassador to Libya.

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: Image enhancements came back.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: We going steady?

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: The sun position tells us the windows are facing northeast.  Here's the best -- look at the glass on the prints hanging in the background. There's a reflection of a reflection, out on the street: the corner of a billboard.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Looks like the wheel of a car.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: We talked about these billboards, when we were car shopping! Four- door... they make a wagon, too.  Something Japanese... God, what was it? Toyota... Mazda... Honda... You thought it had no character.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I thought that about all of them. C'mon, think, dammit!!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: You think!! You were there, too!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Call the outdoor advertising companies. Get the location of all the billboards for Japanese cars within our search parameters.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: ...Peerless Auto Security. We need to know whether you've sold a large quantity of these components to any one customer, or whether you'd had any stolen recently...

Speaker: operative
Dialogue: ...Missile heading to L.A. has a Kipchak Warhead! Repeat: missile is Kipchak equipped! It was switched by order of --

Speaker: joy
Dialogue: Oh, my God...

Speaker: president
Dialogue: So what the hell does "Kipchak" mean?

Speaker: intelligence officer
Dialogue: Uh, it's a code name... for weapons using the Yersinia Pestis bacillus...

Speaker: intelligence officer
Dialogue: Kipchaks were Asian nomads. In 1347 they attacked a Genoese fort, and catapulted infected corpses over the walls. The Genoese who survived carried the disease back to Europe... and it killed half the population.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: Get to the goddamn point, Major.

Speaker: cia chief
Dialogue: Seems the missile is armed with a warhead carrying the Pneumonic Plague.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: The Black Plague?! Every time I talk to you fuckin' guys it gets worse! What happened to this "limited retaliation" shit?

Speaker: cia chief
Dialogue: We think one of the Hard-liners switched the warhead without the Premier's knowledge. But he's not about to take our word for it, and he's too weak to risk the humiliation of backing down.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: They use a biological weapon on American soil, they have to know we'll respond!

Speaker: president
Dialogue: What the hell are we doing in L.A.?

Speaker: president
Dialogue: All right. Assuming the worst... What'll happen?

Speaker: intelligence officer
Dialogue: The warhead vents the plague bacteria above the target area, infecting about 50,000 people. First symptoms are vomiting, lymph nodes become swollen; temperature rises to 105. Victims turn deep purple from lung hemorrhaging, usually die the same day.  There are treatments -- streptomycin and tetracyclines -- but we'd be overwhelmed by the numbers and its extreme contagiousness.

Speaker: cia chief
Dialogue: We could have 500,000 infected in a week, who knows how many after that.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: I'm gonna toast those fuckers! Have the Summit leaders been warned?

Speaker: fbi chief
Dialogue: Yes, sir... no one's landing in L.A. 'til we give the all-clear.

Speaker: president
Dialogue: And you're sure it's safe if we can get 'em to destroy the missile in flight?

Speaker: intelligence officer
Dialogue: The bacteria can't survive the heat of an explosion.

Speaker: cia chief
Dialogue: I suggest none of this go any further -- not even to the agents working to find the family. Word leaks out to a city of 12 million people there's rocket full of the Plague coming at 'em, you'll create a panic of biblical proportions.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Say what?

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: Perhaps someone will decide it is foolish to incur the wrath of North Korea.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Yeah, the U.S. is behind the whole thing. And we're knocking our heads, trying to find your people, just for show.

Speaker: walther
Dialogue: Carson...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Let's grab a few beers, kick back 'til five o'clock rolls by. Then maybe we can have a war over it. I think that's a great idea, seeing as how you fuckers have needed your clocks cleaned for fifty years now!

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: Why wait until five?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Pete!  Christ, you're self-indulgent! There's nothing but anger and cynicism left inside you, so they're all you can express any more. No wonder everyone in the Bureau thinks you're such a nutcase!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Hey, I'm not the only one with a rep around the office... "Dr. Knoll-It- All."

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: You've been dying to tell me that...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Miranda...  Shit.

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: ...Yeah, Peerless Auto Security... fine... get your manager...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Everyone shut up!  Guy on vacation, the Canadian --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Six foot, sandy hair, spooky eyes?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I need a full name, address, anything you got!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: That's appropriate...  In 30 seconds you're gonna give me Paul Javal's shoe size.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Carson...

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: Ambient background sound is normal city stuff, but there's a distinct echo pattern. Your people are in or near a high-rise that's at least eight floors tall. And there are other high-rises nearby.

Speaker: edwards
Dialogue: One more thing: There's an emergency siren approaching at 17 seconds into the second call, passing the location

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Okay -- high-rises in our search area. Eight stories or higher.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Downtown, Century City, Westwood corridor, Museum Row, Mid- Wilshire... North of Sunset Strip there's a few...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Sabatini! What about that billboard?

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: Nothing yet! Everyone's left their goddamn offices already!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: LAPD will have a record of all emergency vehicles running Code 3 at 9:32 AM. Get their starting point and their destination.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: And have them narrow their foot- searches to areas around high-rises.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Where's that fuckin' address?!

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: I'm still holdin'!

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: French by birth... looks like a total scumbag.

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: Isn't that redundant?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Raised in Quebec. Moved to Europe; served some short stretches, petty shit... arrested for kidnapping, no conviction. Did four years in France for blowing bank vaults. Moved to U.S. last year. Clean since then.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Get his Driver's License number; Social; bank accounts; charge cards; club memberships... find out what movies he rented.  Get whoever's closest to the Auto Shop to get in there, interview everybody.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: This sure was a ballsy move for a car-alarm installer.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Hey, he watched the news... Everyone knows the U.S. will do anything to avoid trouble with a mad-dog country.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Ambassador --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: -- Quit apologizing for me!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Quit giving me reasons to!

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: On occasion, my wife has been known to kick my ankle under the table.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Sounds like her aim's a little low.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Address, according to the Auto Shop.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: She's got the field experience.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: There still could be accomplices. If there are, they'll hear us in the helicopter.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: There's a TV station a couple blocks away. We'll land on their pad.  K-EYE. Clear it with 'em. Have a SWAT team assemble, but tell 'em to hang back unless we need 'em.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Oh, great, the media...  It's the goddamn traffic girl!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Traffic person.

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: We can't get into that right now...

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: Hey, you expect to use my station's facilities and not even tell us --

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Sorry...

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: What the fuck are you, the Barbie Corporate Ass-Lick model?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Guess what, Sister... you're about to spend the next five years in a penitentiary for interfering with a federal investigation.

Speaker: station manager
Dialogue: Bobbi! I promised we'd respect their news blackout!

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: Figures... you dickless wonder.

Speaker: station manager
Dialogue: I get an exclusive later, right?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: This works out, I'll play the fuckin' banjo for you.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: We're hoofing it.

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: 'She's got the field experience'... To park the fuckin' car!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Whoa... FBI..!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: How the hell you get here so fast?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Terrific. Who else is here?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Tell 'em to be cool. We're going up.  Give me your master key.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: What the fuck..!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Sorry...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Wait here.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I'm in. It's empty, but sit tight while I look around.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I like what you've done with the place...

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: Wait!

Speaker: sabatini
Dialogue: Where's Carson?

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: Inside.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: NO! --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I said keep everyone back!!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Stop it!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Get out of my sight.

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: Marchfelder.

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: You need a traffic ticket fixed?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: What's the status?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Hurry it the hell up.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I should've known she'd come up.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Pete --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: -- "Should've." Shit, there's a familiar word.  That day... I was there soon enough. We should've rushed 'em, before they could finish setting up...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: The Bureau never would've let you. They want it by the book: talk them out.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Twelve bodies -- only the hostages.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: You were a greenhorn. It wasn't your decision. You can't keep living as such a raw nerve, never sleeping --

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: -- Those kids were ten years old!  Same age as the Han boy...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: C'mon! Who's pulling Javal's bank records? What about cross-referencing possible aliases? We got 33 minutes!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Camry! The billboard! Toyota Camry!  Where are the numbers for the outdoor ad companies?

Speaker: robbins
Dialogue: Parker Center's making those calls.

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: Turn the fuckin' camera on! DO IT!!

Speaker: cameraman
Dialogue: Maybe it's true... probably is true. That's why they got a news blackout!

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: I'll rip your miserable eyeballs out! NEWS IS OUR FUCKIN' JOB!!

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: ...A warning was radioed to U.S. Intelligence that a biological weapon, allegedly containing the deadly Pneumonic Plague, is approaching Los Angeles. While unconfirmed, the President and other leaders are all late in arriving...

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Finally got the call list from Javal's phone. Most aren't his; they're from the legit user who didn't know his number was cloned.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Go to the bottom of the list, work back through the last 12 hours.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Here's the call to the Consulate -- 965-5000.  The rest are dupes... all from the other guy...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Wait... go back... the one at seven this morning...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Get down!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: MIRANDA!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Go..!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Get the fuck out of here!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Shit, it's like a Godzilla movie out here!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Miranda..!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I want you to get out of here...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Dave? You staying on top of the research?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: I can't... My kids...

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Okay...

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: Don't lose the Benz, moron... pull back... show the other copters around us... this is fuckin' great...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: ...The Colonel hired Javal, made it look like he was working alone. Then he made sure Javal got killed, so we'd never find your family -- and they'd have an excuse to drop their bomb. But what's in it for 'em?

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: There are men in my government whose power depends on North Korea staying as it is: Socialist, repressive, isolated from the world. They'll resort to anything, even war, to keep it that way. They have the Hitler Syndrome: if their country cannot exist the way they want it, they would rather see it destroyed.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Negative -- his car's armored! And we need the bastard alive!!

Speaker: vreeland
Dialogue: Shit! Pull back!

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: Uh, I think we're gonna set down now. Back to you, Brent.

Speaker: vreeland
Dialogue: Out of the air, or retreat 7,000 meters from target vehicle!

Speaker: joy
Dialogue: I always hated that guy...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: One of yours?  What the hell do you need heat- seeking rockets for in L.A.?

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: There could be another riot...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Dave, what do you know about...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Strela-2 anti-aircraft rockets?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: I'm with ya... Strela-2. Perenosniy zenitniy raketniy kompleks. Russian factory index 9K-32-M2 --

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Stay back. LAPD's putting up a roadblock.

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: Save it for someone who gives a shit!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: That Kraut-mobile have any weaknesses you'd like to tell me about?

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: I don't think so -- they said it was solid as a rock.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: No shit...

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: I can't believe I'm still alive...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: This were a Hyundai you wouldn't be.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Get me out of here...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Anybody see him?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Dave... You're sure those rockets are heat-seeking?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Just keep working your leads...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: This is Carson. I need a copter.

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: Get this fuckin' thing in the air!  Out! Not enough room for four.

Speaker: cameraman
Dialogue: What am I supposed to do when the plague comes, hold my breath?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: What on earth are you thinking?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Pete, you haven't gone... suicidal or anything on me, have you?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: You?! I wanted a police copter!

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: Just tell me what to do. I flew two tours in 'Nam.

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: And he doesn't go unless I go!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Wrong-o...

Speaker: bobbi
Dialogue: I'm a respected electronic journalist, you fuckin' prick!!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Got 'im -- looks like he's headed

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Pull hard to the left, on my signal...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Now!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: You fucking lunatic!!

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: Hope you got more flares than he's got rockets.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Sorry...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: You're completely deranged! Playing chicken with rockets!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Well, what the hell were you doing out there?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Oh, for Christ's sake... Hold on!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Even if we can pry him out with...  Twelve minutes to go, I doubt he'll be very cooperative.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: I'll just use my outstanding people skills.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: That car's like a rock, right?

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Ever hear of "fuck-me" pumps? Well, these are fuck you pumps!  Where's the family?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Holy shit -- Knoll-It-All's turned into Dirty Harriet!

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: You're sure there were no accounts in the other names I gave you?

Speaker: ambassador han
Dialogue: Let him up.

Speaker: colonel lee
Dialogue: Victory!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Dave...

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Take a hint. We're screwed.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Wait! One of Javal's alias accounts: check for an apartment rental!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: ...Have the Manager evacuate the complex. Find out which unit the family's in, but don't let anyone go in 'til we get there.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Then kick the fuckin' door down!

Speaker: milton
Dialogue: I'll try him in his car again...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: "Fuck-you" pumps??

Speaker: joy
Dialogue: They must know we're here...

Speaker: all
Dialogue: Help!

Speaker: joy
Dialogue: Mother... Sam...

Speaker: milton
Dialogue: It's a brown binder... Says "Rental Manifest." You can't miss it...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Apartment number would be real helpful, gang...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: There!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Okay... work with me here!

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Hurry, please hurry...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: DON'T!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: We have to go out the window.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Too risky. Let's concentrate on getting you out of here.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Sound detectors?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: High-tech problem, low-tech solution.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Pressure sensors. Use 'em in convertibles: Bad guy sits on your seat, he sets the alarm off. These are rigged backwards -- get up, you set 'em off.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You a bomb expert?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Nope. But I've had some car alarms in my day.  For all the goddamn good they do...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Slide your arm forward... Watch the meter... Keep the pressure on the armrest with your elbow...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: It'll squeeze the sensor, duplicate the weight of your arm... Okay... pick it up.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Lean back... Carefully.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Nag, nag, nag...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: You'll be over in five seconds...

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Tell 'em I'm gonna release the hook and ride down on the line.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Release the cable from your side! Get out of here!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Come over the railing! Grab onto the harness!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Tear the hook loose!

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: It'll pop the winch buckle!

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Try it anyway!

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: ...I'll call you next week.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Who was that on the phone?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: The Bureau.  They want me back on the hostage team.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: What did you say?

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: Told 'em I'd sleep on it...

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: Working with you today was certainly... interesting, Inspector.

Speaker: carson
Dialogue: It's my outstanding people skills.

Speaker: miranda
Dialogue: I hate this fucking town...
